value.title: SQL Service Principal Names
value.excerpt: A look at how the SQL SPN's should be formatted and how they get generated.  This was based on an older blog I had published and I still get a lot of questions on this.  What SPN do I use and how does it get there? - http://blogs.msdn.com/b/psssql/archive/2010/03/09/what-spn-do-i-use-and-how-does-it-get-there.aspx

value.title: The BANANAS approach to use Power BI Bookmarks to swap tooltips
value.excerpt: Have you wanted to change the Power BI tooltips dynamically? This BANANAS trick allows you to at least switch the content of a report page tooltip to give you more flexibility and take your report to the next level!  Download Sample: http://guyinacu.be/swaptooltipsample  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Tooltips, tooltips, tooltips in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can display multiple values within a tooltip for a visual. He walks through the DAX measure and also shows some pitfalls to look out for when it comes to filter context.  Go here for the sample DAX statement: https://guyinacube.com/2017/06/tooltips-tooltips-tooltips-power-bi/

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

value.title: Power BI Apps and App Workspaces: How to distribute Power BI content to a Large Audience
value.excerpt: Power BI Apps are a terrific way to distribute your Power BI content to a large audience.  You can "Publish App" to Entire Organization or specific individuals and groups. Then any user (within the Group you provided Access to) can click "Get Apps" to consume your App - which comprises the Dashboards,
